intro: Nothopegia vajravelui, commonly known as the Vajravelu's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral morphology, featuring intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives on the forest floor or as an epiphyte on trees. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
